title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message:
I got this liquid damaged 820-3437.

History is minor liquid spill around U5110. Was not starting. After UC starts when plugin in power supply.

Now when I push pwr on keyboard it immediately resets smc (charger goes green and machine reboots). Also as soon as I put the test-probe on SMC_RESET_L it initiates the smc reset (goes green and reboots). SMC_RESET_L is 3.12V

I changed U5110 and R5100 but still the same issue.

What to do now ?

title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message: Usually trackpad or cable/connector issue. Pin 18 on J4800 is SMC reset line combined with the power switch. I say probably corrosion on the cable/connector/trackpad. In a rare case it could be the keyboard but then the left CRTL,ALT,SHIFT would also not function.

title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message:
Thanks Duke.

But with board out and keyboard connector removed it stills resets the smc when probing SMC_RESET_L.

Why?

title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message: Cause your multimeter is loading it down. Is this an el cheapo meter? But has nothing to do with the trackpad/keyboard issue.

title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message:
It's a Fluke 125 Scopemeter (~2000 USD). Hmmmm.

Normally I can measure SMC_RESET_L without problems

title: 820-3437 - Probing SMC_RESET_L makes SMC reset
message: No but it measured a little bit low (48K). I switched it now measures 99K
